alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 2:25PM CDT until May 28 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nebraska... Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw affecting Red Willow County. Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Stratton affecting Hitchcock County. .Heavy rainfall is causing multiple rivers and creeks to flow over their banks. For the Driftwood Creek...including McCook 4sw...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Driftwood Creek Near McCook 4sw. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Lowland areas will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM CDT Friday was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
